content.text: How to Get Your Degree Certificate Attested for UAE in 2025: Step-by-Step Guide

Planning to work or study in the UAE? Then getting your degree certificate attested is mandatory for your visa approval. This guide will walk you through everything you need to know about degree certificate attestation for UAE in 2025, including the process, timeline, and tips to avoid delays.

Attestation is the process of validating your educational documents for use in a foreign country. The UAE government requires attested educational certificates for employment, higher education, family sponsorships, and professional licensing.
Step-by-Step Process for UAE Degree Certificate Attestation
Your degree certificate must first be notarized by a certified public notary in India.
The Human Resource Department (HRD) of your issuing state will verify the document next. This step is state-specific and can take 5–15 business days.
The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) in India will then attest the degree after HRD verification.
Your final step is attestation by the UAE Embassy in New Delhi. Once completed, your degree is valid for use in the UAE.
